oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reminiscence of the Battle of Memphis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mary Ellet Cabell, daughter of Col. Charles Ellet, who established the U.S. Ram Fleet for the Army, wrote to Col. George B. Corkhill about the heroic actions of her father and brother in the naval battles for Memphis and Vicksburg. Col. Ellet was a noted engineer who outfitted tinclad steamboats to act as rams on the Mississippi River. He was mortally wounded at the Battle of Memphis in 1862.
